meanings.definition: To engulf or ingest particles by phagocytosis.
meanings.sent1: The cell will phagocytize the food particles for energy.
meanings.sent2: The immune system uses white blood cells to phagocytize harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The hungry cell decided to phagocytize the tiny invaders for a snack.
meanings.sent4: Like a vacuum cleaner, the cell can phagocytize any unwanted debris.
meanings.sent5: The amoeba's ability to phagocytize its prey is crucial for survival.

meanings.definition: To consume or destroy foreign particles within a cell.
meanings.sent1: The cell will phagocytize the invading virus to protect itself.
meanings.sent2: The enzymes in the lysosomes help phagocytize unwanted substances within the cell.
meanings.sent3: The cell had a party and decided to phagocytize all the foreign objects.
meanings.sent4: The immune system can phagocytize any threats to keep the body safe.
meanings.sent5: The cell's ability to phagocytize harmful invaders is like a superhero power.
